page.title: 02Ditchingham Primary School
page.content: The school is housed in new buildings in Rider Haggard Way completed in Oct. 1984 consisting of four classrooms, pentagonal hall,library & admin rooms. Prior to completion the school was split site with 2 classes here & 2 in an old school in Station Rd.The latter had opened in 1840 and was preceded by a private school from 1825.There are 115 pupils taught by Headteacher,Keith Weston & 3.5 other staff.A broad curr- iculum is intended to develop each child's potential & every effort is made to match work to individual abil- ity.There are several extra-curricular activities.Non-denominational assembly is held every day.Children in uniform of blue & grey clothing.Each child in a house named after local rivers. The school has a thriving P.T.A. and a Board of ten Governors.
